AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa: defendant in a case involving illegal re-entry after deportation, sentenced to 90 months of imprisonment, native and citizen of Mexico, signed the Plea Agreement and Plea Agreement Addendum, pleaded guilty before a United States Magistrate Judge, has a history of violating immigration laws, alleges counsel was constitutionally ineffective, claims he was factually innocent of Illegal Re-entry due to potential United States citizenship, waived the right to appeal the sentence imposed and the right to contest his conviction or sentence by means of any post-conviction proceeding, testified that he understood the rights he was giving up by pleading guilty, knowingly and voluntarily pleaded guilty and waived his right to file a motion, made claims in his affidavit that were directly contradicted by his own statement in his Plea Agreement Addendum, failed to make a credible showing of deficient performance on the part of his counsel, entered a knowing and voluntary plea, appellant, has a family situation and is a member of a gang, claims United States citizenship
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: the government entity involved in the prosecution of Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Attorney General: government official responsible for permission to re-enter the United States, authorized early disposition programs, oversees 'fast track' downward departure programs
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Secretary of the Department of Homeland: government official responsible for permission to re-enter the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Kazen: Senior United States District Judge who entered an Order adopting the Report and Recommendation of the United States Magistrate Judge, presiding over Valero's case, sentenced Valero to 90 months of imprisonment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.counsel: Valero's lawyer, helped Valero understand the rights he was giving up by pleading guilty, rendered effective assistance according to Valero's express acknowledgment, subject to standards that consider the acuity of hindsight and the art of representation, allegedly failed to recognize benefits and errors in sentencing, including failure to request 'fast track' downward departure or investigate Valero's claim of United States citizenship, failed to rely on Guidelines Amendment 742 for calculation of criminal history points, argued on behalf of Valero regarding the calculation of his criminal history score, did not fail in performance by not raising meritless claims about fast track programs
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Petitioner: Rogelio Valero-De La Rosa, filed a motion that was denied
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Joseph M. Hood: Senior U.S. District Judge who signed the order granting the government's motion for summary judgment/motion to dismiss Valero's motion, presiding over Valero's sentencing
